meanings.definition: To exaggerate or overemphasize the importance or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: She always overhypes her favorite movies, making them sound better than they are.
meanings.sent2: The company tends to overhype their products, leading to disappointment among customers.
meanings.sent3: He overhypes his cooking skills, but his burnt toast tells a different story.
meanings.sent4: The salesman overhypes the benefits of the vacuum cleaner, claiming it can clean up a mess in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The author overhypes the book, but readers find it to be just average.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise something in an excessive or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant overhypes its grand opening with flashy banners and loud music.
meanings.sent2: Some companies tend to overhype their products, making consumers skeptical of their claims.
meanings.sent3: The magician overhypes his disappearing act, but the audience sees him sneak offstage.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity overhypes her skincare line, promising miraculous results overnight.
meanings.sent5: The travel agency overhypes the tropical vacation, but tourists find it crowded and overpriced.
